problem_text: (Shi Shengming). Is it true that a finite p-soluble group G has a p-block of defect zero if and only if there exists an element x ∈ Op′(G) such that CG(x) is a p′-subgroup? Jiping Zhang
answer: No, it is not. The group 32.GL2(3) has a 2-block of defect 0, but the centralizer of every element from O(G) has even order (V. I. Zenkov, in: Trudy Inst. Matem. i Mekh. UrO RAN, 3 (1995), 36–40 (Russian)).
